protocol.name: Affymetrix:Protocol:Hybridization-EukGE-WS2v5
protocol.text: Title: Affymetrix in vitro transcription. Description:

protocol.name: P-MEXP-10773
text: Catalase-deficient (CAT2HP1) and control (PTHW) plants were obtained as described by Vandenabeele et al. (2004):
Production of transgenic Arabidopsis thaliana with decreased CAT2 levels

A 515-bp PCR product of the 5\222; prime coding sequence of CAT2  (5\222;-CGCGGATCCTTAGTATCG-3?; 5?-CGCGGATCCTCCAGTTCTCTTGGATGTGAG-3?) was  inserted as a BamHI fragment into pH35SCATS and selected for inverted  direction by PCR. A PstI fragment was ligated into the PstI-digested  pthw142 vector, a binary vector containing the bialaphos resistance gene  (BAR), which is a resistance gene for transformant selection. Binary  constructs were mobilized into Agrobacterium tumefaciens (pMP90) with  the Escherichia coli helper strain HB101. A. thaliana (L) Heyhn.  Ecotype Col-4 plants were transformed by floral dip (Clough and Bent,  1998). The resulting CAT2HP1 plants contain 20% residual catalase  activity. The control plants, named Pthw plants, result from  transformation of an empty pthw142 vector into Col-4 plants.
Vandenabeele S, Vanderauwera S, Vuylsteke M, Rombauts S, Langebartels C,  Seidlitz HK, Zabeau M, Van Montagu M, Inzé D, Van Breusegem F (2004).  Plant J 39: 45 58
Vanderauwera S, Zimmermann P, Rombauts S, Vandenabeele S, Langebartels  C, Gruissem W, Inzé D, and Van Breusegem F. (2005). Plant Physiology  139(2):806-821:

Unless mentioned otherwise, the plants were grown under controlled conditions in phytotron exposure chambers, which had been especially designed for plant stress research (Thiel et al., 1996). The light regime was 12 h/12 h at 100 to 140 umol m-2 s-1, the climate adjusted to a relative humidity of 70 pct, and 22C/18C day/night temperatures.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-10776
protocol.text: For high light (HL) treatments, 6-week-old plants were transferred to a sun simulator with identical growth conditions and exposed to continuous HL irradiation (photosynthetically active radiation 400 to 700 nm at approximately 1,600 to 1,800 umol m-2 s-1). Zero, 3, and 8 h after the onset of HL stress, middle-aged leaves of 20 to 30 plants per line were sampled and pooled for RNA analysis. The two biological repeat experiments were done with a temporal interval of 1 year.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-10777
protocol.text: In two independent experiments, RNA was isolated from leaves of 20 to 30 control or catalase-deficient plants with the TRIzol Reagent (Invitrogen). The concentration of total RNA was determined with a Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer, and the quality was examined with the RNA 6000 Nano Assay (Agilent Technologies, 2100 Bioanalyzer).

protocol.name: P-MEXP-10784
text: Each of the different pools of control and CAT2HP1 plants, subjected for 0, 3, and 8 h of high light irradiation, was hybridized to one Affymetrix chip (Genechip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array; Affymetrix). For each hybridization, 15 ug of total RNA was used. Affymetrix chip analyses were performed at the Functional Genomics Center Zurich and the VIB Microarray Facility (Leuven, Belgium). Conditions for reverse transcription, RNA labeling, hybridization, and scanning were according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Affymetrix;

. affymetrix.com/) :  The hybridisation protocol is derived from the “GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual” (Section 2 Eukaryotic sample and array processing). The document can be found at the affymetrix website:

Within this document (expression_s2_manual.pdf), the following sections are applicable for the hybridization protocol:  2.2.3 Eukaryotic Target Hybridization  2.2.5 Reagents and Materials Required  2.2.6 Reagent Preparation  2.2.7-2.2.8 Eukaryotic Target Hybridization  2.3.3 Eukaryotic Arrays: Washing and staining  2.3.5 Reagents and Materials Required  2.3.6 Reagent Preparation  2.3.7 - 2.3.8 Experiment and Fluidics Station Setup  2.3.9 -2.3.14 Probe Array Wash and Stain

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7837
text: Affymetrix  Labelling protocol for ARE-ATH1 array  The labelling protocol is applicable for use with the GeneChip ARE-ATH1 when starting with a minimal amount of 5ug total RNA.  The protocol is derived from the “GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual” (Section 2 Eukaryotic sample and array processing). The document can be found at the affymetrix website:

Within this document (expression_s2_manual.pdf), the following sections are applicable for the labelling protocol:  2.1.3 Eukaryotic Target Preparation 2.1.7 - 2.1.8 Reagents and Materials Required 2.1.13 - 2.1.18 One-Cycle cDNA Synthesis  2.1.32 - 2.1.33 Cleanup of Double Stranded cDNA for Both the One-Cycle and Two-Cycle Target Labelling Assays 2.1.34 - 2.1.35 Synthesis of Biotin-Labelled cRNA for both the One-Cycle and Two-Cycle Target Labelling Assays. 2.1.36 2.1.38– Cleanup and Quantification of Biotin-Labelled cRNA 2.1.39 – 2.1.40 Fragmenting the cRNA for Target Preparation
